books.contributor: by Adam Wallace. Illustrated by Andy Elkerton
books.description: Children attempt to capture the mythical creature. (Ages 4 to 8)
books.title: HOW TO CATCH A UNICORN

books.contributor: by Victoria Monét. Illustrated by Alea Marley
books.description: A message of unconditional love. (Ages 2 to 5)

books.contributor: by Suzanne Lang. Illustrated by Max Lang
books.description: Jim Panzee is having a bad day. (Ages 3 to 7)
books.title: GRUMPY MONKEY

books.author: Lisa Jewell
books.description: A man with dark secrets in his past may cause trouble for three women who did not heed the warning about him.
books.title: DON'T LET HIM IN

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: After her handbag is stolen during a trip to Paris, a best-selling author with a traumatic past determines not to be a victim.
books.title: A MOTHER'S LOVE

books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.description: In the summer of 1980, Joan Goodwin begins training with a group of candidates for NASA’s space shuttle program.
books.title: ATMOSPHERE

books.author: Carley Fortune
books.description: A photographer returns to a place where she spent a summer as a teenager and runs into the guy she had a crush on back then.
books.title: ONE GOLDEN SUMMER

books.author: Kate Stewart
books.description: The second book in the Ravenhood Legacy series. Tyler gets his friend’s aunt to help him on his quest to become a man before his time.
books.title: SEVERED HEART

books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: Things take an unsettling turn when a marketing executive loses his job and a woman rents a room in his brownstone.
books.title: THE TENANT

books.author: Navessa Allen
books.description: The second book of the Into Darkness series. Nico “Junior” Trocci and Lauren Marchetti become ensnared in a game of seduction.
books.title: CAUGHT UP

books.author: Bill Clinton and James Patterson
books.contributor: by Bill Clinton and James Patterson
books.description: When President Wright’s husband goes on trial for murder, a pair of journalists search for answers.
books.title: THE FIRST GENTLEMAN

books.author: Stephen King
books.description: Holly Gibney does double duty by helping head off acts of retribution and protecting a women’s rights activist.
books.title: NEVER FLINCH

books.author: Emily Henry
books.description: A writer looking for her big break competes against a Pulitzer winner to tell the story of an octogenarian with a storied past.
books.title: GREAT BIG BEAUTIFUL LIFE

books.author: Ali Hazelwood
books.description: Things get complicated between an older biotech guy and a struggling graduate student who go to a destination wedding.
books.title: PROBLEMATIC SUMMER ROMANCE

books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.description: The third book in the Empyrean series. As enemies gain traction, Violet Sorrengail goes beyond the Aretian wards in search of allies.
books.title: ONYX STORM

books.author: Fredrik Backman
books.description: A young woman looks into the story behind a painting that was made 25 years ago and a small group of teens depicted in it; translated by Neil Smith.
books.title: MY FRIENDS

books.author: Shelby Van Pelt
books.description: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.
books.title: REMARKABLY BRIGHT CREATURES

books.author: Wally Lamb
books.description: A man struggling in several areas of his life is sentenced to prison, where he encounters acts of kindness and brutality.
books.title: THE RIVER IS WAITING

books.author: Johnny Joey Jones
books.description: The Fox News military analyst extols the first responders among his friends and family.
books.title: BEHIND THE BADGE

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Jonathan Haidt
books.description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.
books.title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION

books.author: E. Jean Carroll
books.description: The journalist shares moments from her life and the two trials in which she accused President Trump of sexual assault and defamation.
books.title: NOT MY TYPE

books.author: Ron Chernow
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer portrays the life and career of the literary celebrity and political pundit.
books.title: MARK TWAIN

books.author: Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson
books.contributor: by Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson
books.description: A New York Times opinion columnist and a staff writer at The Atlantic evaluate obstacles to American progress.
books.title: ABUNDANCE

books.author: Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
books.contributor: by Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
books.description: An account of Joe Biden’s initial decision to run for re-election in 2024 and its numerous consequences.
books.title: ORIGINAL SIN

books.author: John Green
books.description: The author of “The Anthropocene Reviewed” chronicles the fight against the deadly infectious disease tuberculosis.
books.title: EVERYTHING IS TUBERCULOSIS

books.author: Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.title: ON TYRANNY

books.author: Amanda Montell
books.description: The author of “The Age of Magical Overthinking” evaluates language techniques used by various groups to develop followers.
books.title: CULTISH

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.
books.title: THE WAGER

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the former host of “The Daily Show.”
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Nate Bargatze
books.description: The Grammy Award-nominated comedian shares snippets from his life and career.
books.title: BIG DUMB EYES

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.description: The journalist shares moments from her life and the two trials in which she accused President Trump of sexual assault and defamation.
books.title: NOT MY TYPE

books.author: Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson
books.contributor: by Ezra Klein and Derek Thompson
books.description: A New York Times opinion columnist and a staff writer at The Atlantic evaluate obstacles to American progress.
books.title: ABUNDANCE

books.author: John Green
books.description: The author of “The Anthropocene Reviewed” chronicles the fight against the deadly infectious disease tuberculosis.
books.title: EVERYTHING IS TUBERCULOSIS

books.author: Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
books.contributor: by Jake Tapper and Alex Thompson
books.description: An account of Joe Biden’s initial decision to run for re-election in 2024 and its numerous consequences.
books.title: ORIGINAL SIN

books.author: Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.contributor: by Peter Attia with Bill Gifford
books.description: A look at recent scientific research on aging and longevity.
books.title: OUTLIVE

books.author: Nate Bargatze
books.description: The Grammy Award-nominated comedian shares snippets from his life and career.
books.title: BIG DUMB EYES

books.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: The author of “Braiding Sweetgrass” illuminates how the gift economy in the natural world works and draws lessons for our economy; with illustrations by John Burgoyne.
books.title: THE SERVICEBERRY

books.author: Michael Harriot
books.description: A columnist at TheGrio.com articulates moments in American history that center the perspectives and experiences of Black Americans.
books.title: BLACK AF HISTORY

books.author: Paul Kalanithi
books.description: A memoir by a physician who received a diagnosis of Stage IV lung cancer at the age of 36.
books.title: WHEN BREATH BECOMES AIR

books.author: Elias Weiss Friedman with Ben Greenman
books.contributor: by Elias Weiss Friedman with Ben Greenman
books.description: The photographer known as the Dogist contends that dog ownership can improve your life.
books.title: THIS DOG WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE

books.author: Alexei Navalny
books.description: A posthumously published memoir by the late Russian political opposition leader and political prisoner who began writing this after his near-fatal poisoning in 2020.
books.title: PATRIOT

books.author: Rick Atkinson
books.description: The author of “The British Are Coming” portrays the middle years of the American Revolution.
books.title: THE FATE OF THE DAY

books.author: Danielle Steel
books.description: A book editor recognizes the trauma incurred by her partner during his military deployments and seeks to restore her sense of self.
books.title: JOY

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: The third book in the Camino series. The last living descendant of the now-deserted island's inhabitants gets in the way of a resort developer.
books.title: CAMINO GHOSTS

books.author: J.D. Robb
books.description: The 59th book of the In Death series. Bad memories come up for Eve Dallas at a crime scene.
books.title: PASSIONS IN DEATH

books.author: William W. Johnstone
books.description: The fifth of the Eagles series. Falcon MacCallister goes after the Noonan gang for the murder of his father.
books.title: RAGE OF EAGLES

books.author: James Patterson
books.description: The 32nd book in the Alex Cross series. When a jet is gunned down, Cross goes back into action.
books.title: ALEX CROSS MUST DIE

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: The third book in the Forever Texas series. As the country splits apart, Regis Royle leads a precarious cattle drive.
books.title: ON THE ROYLE RANGE

books.author: Fern Michaels
books.description: A former government agent who became a school guidance counselor receives a request to return for a specialized assignment.
books.title: THE WILD SIDE

books.author: Debbie Macomber
books.description: A woman from the city and a small-town sheriff develop a relationship that comes with complications.
books.title: THE SHERIFF TAKES A WIFE

books.author: Sharon Sala
books.description: A bull rider who was badly injured on the rodeo circuit begins a relationship with a waitress with a hidden talent for painting.
books.title: SUNSET

books.author: Jason Rekulak
books.description: A 5-year-old’s disturbing artwork may hold clues to an unsolved murder.
books.title: HIDDEN PICTURES

books.author: Brett Battles
books.description: The seventh book in the Teddy Fay series. A film’s European press tour serves as cover for Fay to find out who is killing C.I.A. agents.
books.title: STUART WOODS' GOLDEN HOUR

books.author: Terri Reed
books.description: The third book in the Dakota K-9 Unit series. A park ranger witnesses a co-worker’s murder.
books.title: STANDING WATCH

books.author: Jo Ann Brown
books.description: The second book in the Amish of Lost River series. An Amish seamstress takes in her cousin’s abandoned baby.
books.title: SAVING HER AMISH BABY

books.author: Dana Mentink
books.description: The fourth book in the Security Hounds Investigations series. A K-9 handler searches for a childhood friend’s mother who went missing.
books.title: FOLLOWING THE CLUES

books.author: William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.contributor: by William W. Johnstone and J.A. Johnstone
books.description: Two western stories: “Brutal Night of the Mountain Man” and “Venom of the Mountain Man.”
books.title: I'M HERE TO KILL YOU

books.author: William Kamkwamba and Bryan Mealer
books.contributor: by William Kamkwamba and Bryan Mealer. Illustrated by Anna Hymas
books.title: THE BOY WHO HARNESSED THE WIND

books.author: adapted by David Lewman
books.title: A MINECRAFT MOVIE: THE JUNIOR NOVELIZATION

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.title: ON TYRANNY

books.author: Amanda Montell
books.description: The author of “The Age of Magical Overthinking” evaluates language techniques used by various groups to develop followers.
books.title: CULTISH

books.author: David Grann
books.description: The survivors of a shipwrecked British vessel on a secret mission during an imperial war with Spain have different accounts of events.
books.title: THE WAGER

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the former host of “The Daily Show.”
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.title: EDUCATED

books.author: Hampton Sides
books.description: The author of “On Desperate Ground” depicts Captain James Cook’s final voyage and the controversies surrounding its legacy.
books.title: THE WIDE WIDE SEA

books.author: Jeannette Walls
books.description: The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.
books.title: THE GLASS CASTLE

books.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
books.description: An evaluation of impactful and unpredictable events and the rationalizations that may accompany them.
books.title: THE BLACK SWAN

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice.
books.title: OUTLIERS

books.author: Amy Tan
books.description: Essays and drawings by the author of “The Joy Luck Club” and “The Bonesetter's Daughter,” which depict a search for peace through birding.
books.title: THE BACKYARD BIRD CHRONICLES

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: S.C. Gwynne
books.description: The story of Quanah Parker, the last chief of the Comanches.
books.title: EMPIRE OF THE SUMMER MOON

books.author: bell hooks
books.description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.
books.title: ALL ABOUT LOVE

books.author: Carley Fortune
books.description: A photographer returns to a place where she spent a summer as a teenager and runs into the guy she had a crush on back then.
books.title: ONE GOLDEN SUMMER

books.author: Kate Stewart
books.description: The second book in the Ravenhood Legacy series. Tyler gets his friend’s aunt to help him on his quest to become a man before his time.
books.title: SEVERED HEART

books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: Things take an unsettling turn when a marketing executive loses his job and a woman rents a room in his brownstone.
books.title: THE TENANT

books.author: Navessa Allen
books.description: The second book of the Into Darkness series. Nico “Junior” Trocci and Lauren Marchetti become ensnared in a game of seduction.
books.title: CAUGHT UP

books.author: Freida McFadden
books.description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.
books.title: THE HOUSEMAID

books.author: Catherine Newman
books.description: During a summer vacation in Cape Cod, Rocky faces changes with her family, body and life.
books.title: SANDWICH

books.author: Shelby Van Pelt
books.description: A widow working the night shift at the Sowell Bay Aquarium is aided in solving a mystery by a giant Pacific octopus living there.
books.title: REMARKABLY BRIGHT CREATURES

books.author: Ali Hazelwood
books.description: Things get complicated between an older biotech guy and a struggling graduate student who go to a destination wedding.
books.title: PROBLEMATIC SUMMER ROMANCE

books.author: Navessa Allen
books.description: As Aly and Josh live out their dark fantasies, someone with sinister intentions impinges on them.
books.title: LIGHTS OUT

books.author: Sarah J. Maas
books.description: After killing a wolf in the woods, Feyre is taken from her home and placed inside the world of the Fae.
books.title: A COURT OF THORNS AND ROSES

books.author: Rebecca Yarros
books.description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.
books.title: FOURTH WING

books.description: To keep up with her co-workers, Scottie Price takes a fake husband with her to a summer marriage camp.

books.description: When the Great Library of Alyssium is set aflame, Kiela and Caz take the spellbooks and bring magic to Kiela’s childhood home.

books.description: A warrior who can transform into a monster must survive boot camp.
books.title: PSYCHO SHIFTERS

books.description: The second book in the Empyrean series. Violet Sorrengail’s next round of training under the new vice commandant might require her to betray the man she loves.
books.title: IRON FLAME

books.author: A.B. Poranek
books.description: A gothic fantasy inspired by "Swan Lake." (Ages 14 and up)
books.title: A TREACHERY OF SWANS

books.author: Allison Saft
books.description: Clarion, the successor to the throne of Pixie Hollow, is determined to confront a monster that threatens the land. (Ages 12 to 18)
books.title: WINGS OF STARLIGHT

books.author: Lynn Painter
books.description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)
books.title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES

books.author: Tahereh Mafi
books.description: After 10 years, the Reestablishment looks to make a move on the New Republic of the West. (Ages 14 and up)
books.title: WATCH ME

books.author: Elizabeth Lim
books.description: A girl agrees to marry a dragon lord to ensure her family's safety. (Ages 12 to 17)
books.title: A FORGERY OF FATE

books.author: Kristen Ciccarelli
books.description: Rune, a witch, and Gideon, a witch-hunter, fall in love. (Ages 13 to 18)

books.author: Kristen Ciccarelli
books.description: Rune and Gideon must join forces to stop a sinister plot by Cressida Roseblood. (Ages 13 to 18)
books.title: REBEL WITCH

books.author: Laura Nowlin
books.description: The coming-of-age love story of Autumn and Phineas. (Ages 14 to 18)
books.title: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME

books.author: Rebecca Ross
books.description: Two young rival journalists find love through a magical connection. (Ages 13 to 18)
books.title: DIVINE RIVALS

books.description: Annabel Price's mother was presumed dead, until she reappears during the filming of a documentary about her disappearance. (Ages 14 to 17)

books.title: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME
